00002 // Class for reading named values from configuration files
00003 // Richard J. Wagner  v2.1  24 May 2004  wagnerr@umich.edu

00025 // Typical usage
00026 // -------------
00027 // 
00028 // Given a configuration file "settings.inp":
00029 //   atoms  = 25
00030 //   length = 8.0  # nanometers
00031 //   name = Reece Surcher
00032 // 
00033 // Named values are read in various ways, with or without default values:
00034 //   ConfigFile config( "settings.inp" );
00035 //   int atoms = config.read<int>( "atoms" );
00036 //   double length = config.read( "length", 10.0 );
00037 //   string author, title;
00038 //   config.readInto( author, "name" );
00039 //   config.readInto( title, "title", string("Untitled") );
00040 // 
00041 // See file example.cpp for more examples.
00042 //***************************************************************************
00043 //  Modified 04 February 2011 by
00044 //  Franz Ehrenhuber, Codronic GmbH
00045 //
00046 //  It's now possible to query sections in config files
00047 //  Default sections are defined like [sectionname],
00048 //  but it is possible to use different tags
00049 //  Section related adding/removing of entries is implemented.
00050 //  Changes have to be saved.
00051 //
00052 //  Examples:
00053 //  youbot::ConfigFile *cfgFile = new youbot::ConfigFile("youbot-manipulator", path);
00054 //  cfgFile->readInto( i1, "Joint_5", "UpperLimit_[encoderTicks]");
00055 //  if(cfgFile->keyExists("Joint_3", "CalibrationDirection"))
00056 //  {
00057 //    cout << "Key CalibrationDirection exists" << endl;
00058 //  }
00059 //  cfgFile->remove("Joint_1", "Test");
00060 //  cfgFile->add("Joint_1", "Test1", 77);
00061 //  cfgFile->save();
00062 //***************************************************************************
00063

00082   class SortTreeVector {
00083   protected:
00084     string myKey;
00085     vector<string> mySortVector;
00086 
00087   public:
00088 
00089     SortTreeVector() {
00090       myKey = "";
00091     };
00092 
00093     string getKey() {
00094       if (myKey.empty()) return "";
00095 
00096       if (myKey.size() > 0) {
00097         return myKey;
00098       }
00099 
00100       return "";
00101 
00102 
00103     }
00104 
00105     void setKey(const string& sKey) {
00106       myKey = sKey;
00107     }
00108 
00109     std::vector<string> getVector() const {
00110       return mySortVector;
00111     }
00112 
00113     void setVector(const std::vector<string>& vVector) {
00114       mySortVector = vVector;
00115     }
00116 
00117     ~SortTreeVector() {
00118     };
00119 
00120   };

00122   class ConfigFile {
00123     // Data
00124   protected:
00125     string myDelimiter; // separator between key and value
00126     string myComment; // separator between value and comments
00127     string mySectionStartTag; // tag marks the beginning of a section header
00128     string mySectionEndTag; // tag marks the end of a section header
00129     string mySentry; // optional string to signal end of file
00130     string myFilepath; //Path to Configfile
00131     SortTreeVector *mySortVectorObj; // Keeps vector for sorting contents and its relation to the Section Key
00132 
00133     std::map<string, string> myContents; // extracted keys and values
00134     std::map<string, std::map<string, string> > mySectionRelatedContents; // A List of all sections with their extrated key/values
00135 
00136     std::vector<SortTreeVector> mySortVector; // keeps SortTreeVector objects for sorting on Sections an their contents
00137 
00138     typedef std::map<string, string>::iterator mapi;
00139     typedef std::map<string, string>::const_iterator mapci;
00140     typedef std::map<string, map<string, string> >::const_iterator mapciSect;
00141 
00142     // Methods
00143   public:
00144 
00145     ConfigFile(string filename,
00146             string filepath = "../config/",
00147             string delimiter = "=",
00148             string comment = "#",
00149             string sectionStartTag = "[",
00150             string sectionEndTag = "]",
00151             string sentry = "EndConfigFile");
00152     ConfigFile();
00153     
00154     ~ConfigFile(){};
00155

00157     template<class T> T read(const string& key, const T& value)const;

00170

00172     bool readInto(T& var, const string& key, const T& value) const;
00173 
00174     // Modify keys and values
00175     template<class T> void add(string key, const T& value);
00176

00178     template<class T> void add(string sectionKey, string key, const T& value);
00179

00182     void remove(const string& key);
00183     //Remove one key from specified section
00184     void remove(const string& sectionKey, const string& key);
00185 
00186     //Save Changes to Configfile
00187     //should be invoked after removing/adding keys
00188     void save();
00189

00194     // Overload to check key inside a section

00196

00198     bool sectionExists(const string& sectionKey);

00209       return myComment;

00217       string old = myDelimiter;
00218       myDelimiter = s;
00219       return old;
00220     }

00223       string old = myComment;

00239   /* static */
00240   template<class T>
00241   string ConfigFile::T_as_string(const T& t) {
00242     // Convert from a T to a string
00243     // Type T must support << operator
00244     std::ostringstream ost;
00245     ost << t;
00246     return ost.str();
00247   }
00248 
00249   /* static */
00250   template<class T>
00251   T ConfigFile::string_as_T(const string& s) {
00252     // Convert from a string to a T
00253     // Type T must support >> operator
00254     T t;
00255     std::istringstream ist(s);
00256     ist >> t;
00257     return t;
00258   }
00259 
00260   /* static */
00261   template<>
00262   inline string ConfigFile::string_as_T<string>(const string& s) {
00263     // Convert from a string to a string
00264     // In other words, do nothing
00265     return s;
00266   }
00267 
00268   /* static */
00269   template<>
00270   inline bool ConfigFile::string_as_T<bool>(const string& s) {
00271     // Convert from a string to a bool
00272     // Interpret "false", "F", "no", "n", "0" as false
00273     // Interpret "true", "T", "yes", "y", "1", "-1", or anything else as true
00274     bool b = true;
00275     string sup = s;
00276     for (string::iterator p = sup.begin(); p != sup.end(); ++p)
00277       *p = toupper(*p); // make string all caps
00278     if (sup == string("FALSE") || sup == string("F") ||
00279             sup == string("NO") || sup == string("N") ||
00280             sup == string("0") || sup == string("NONE"))
00281       b = false;
00282     return b;
00283   }
00284 
00285   template<class T>
00286   T ConfigFile::read(const string& key) const {
00287     mapci p = myContents.find(key);
00288     if (p == myContents.end()) throw KeyNotFoundException(key);
00289     return string_as_T<T > (p->second);
00290   }
00291 
00292   template<class T>
00293   T ConfigFile::read(const string& sectionKey, const string& key) {
00294     // Read the value corresponding to key
00295     mapciSect sp = mySectionRelatedContents.find(sectionKey);
00296     if (sp == mySectionRelatedContents.end()) throw KeyNotFoundException(sectionKey);
00297 
00298     myContents = sp->second;
00299     mapci p = myContents.find(key);
00300     if (p == myContents.end()) throw KeyNotFoundException(key);
00301     return string_as_T<T > (p->second);
00302   }
00303 
00304   template<class T>
00305   T ConfigFile::read(const string& key, const T& value) const {
00306     // Return the value corresponding to key or given default value
00307     // if key is not found
00308     mapci p = myContents.find(key);
00309     if (p == myContents.end()) return value;
00310     return string_as_T<T > (p->second);
00311   }
00312 
00313   template<class T>
00314   bool ConfigFile::readInto(T& var, const string& key) const {
00315     // Get the value corresponding to key and store in var
00316     // Return true if key is found
00317     // Otherwise leave var untouched
00318 
00319     mapci p = myContents.find(key);
00320     bool found = (p != myContents.end());
00321     if (found) {
00322       var = string_as_T<T > (p->second);
00323     } else {
00324       throw KeyNotFoundException(key);
00325     }
00326     return found;
00327   }
00328 
00329   template<class T>
00330   bool ConfigFile::readInto(T& var, const string& sectionKey, const string& key) {
00331     // Get the value corresponding to key and store in var
00332     // Return true if key is found
00333     // Otherwise leave var untouched
00334 
00335     mapciSect sp = mySectionRelatedContents.find(sectionKey);
00336     if (sp == mySectionRelatedContents.end()) throw KeyNotFoundException(sectionKey);
00337 
00338 
00339     myContents = sp->second;
00340 
00341     mapci p = myContents.find(key);
00342     bool found = (p != myContents.end());
00343     if (found) {
00344       var = string_as_T<T > (p->second);
00345     } else {
00346       throw KeyNotFoundException(key);
00347     }
00348     return found;
00349   }
00350 
00351   template<class T>
00352   void ConfigFile::add(string key, const T& value) {
00353     // Add a key with given value
00354     string v = T_as_string(value);
00355     trim(key);
00356     trim(v);
00357     //Check for dublicate keys
00358     mapi p = myContents.find(key);
00359     if (p != myContents.end()) {
00360       return;
00361     }
00362     myContents[key] = v;
00363     return;
00364   }
00365 
00366   template<class T>
00367   void ConfigFile::add(string sectionKey, string key, const T& value) {
00368 
00369 
00370     // Add a key with given value
00371     string v = T_as_string(value);
00372     trim(key);
00373     trim(v);
00374 
00375     mapciSect sp = mySectionRelatedContents.find(sectionKey);
00376 
00377     //Write SectionKey  with values if no section found
00378     if (sp == mySectionRelatedContents.end()) {
00379       SortTreeVector vsort;
00380       vector<string> vNewVal;
00381       map<string, string> newMap;
00382       newMap[key] = v;
00383       vsort.setKey(sectionKey);
00384       vNewVal.push_back(key);
00385       vsort.setVector(vNewVal);
00386       mySectionRelatedContents[sectionKey] = newMap;
00387       mySortVector.push_back(vsort);
00388       return;
00389     }
00390 
00391     myContents = sp->second;
00392 
00393     //Check for dublicate keys
00394     mapi p = myContents.find(key);
00395     if (p != myContents.end()) {
00396       return;
00397     }
00398 
00399     myContents[key] = v;
00400     mySectionRelatedContents[sectionKey] = myContents;
00401 
00402     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < mySortVector.size(); i++) {
00403 
00404       if (mySortVector[i].getKey() == sectionKey) {
00405         vector<string> sortVec = mySortVector[i].getVector();
00406         sortVec.push_back(key);
00407         mySortVector[i].setVector(sortVec);
00408 
00409 
00410       }
00411     }
00412 
00413 
00414     return;
00415   }

00422 // Release notes:
00423 // v1.0  21 May 1999
00424 //   + First release
00425 //   + Template read() access only through non-member readConfigFile()
00426 //   + ConfigurationFileBool is only built-in helper class
00427 // 
00428 // v2.0  3 May 2002
00429 //   + Shortened name from ConfigurationFile to ConfigFile
00430 //   + Implemented template member functions
00431 //   + Changed default comment separator from % to #
00432 //   + Enabled reading of multiple-line values
00433 // 
00434 // v2.1  24 May 2004
00435 //   + Made template specializations inline to avoid compiler-dependent linkage
00436 //   + Allowed comments within multiple-line values
00437 //   + Enabled blank line termination for multiple-line values
00438 //   + Added optional sentry to detect end of configuration file
00439 //   + Rewrote messy trimWhitespace() function as elegant trim()
00440 //
00441 // v2.2 04 February 2011
00442 //  + Added Section support
00443 //  + Check for duplicate key in add-Method
00444 //  + Removed KeyNotFoundexception in remove-Method because it is
00445 //    more convenient not to interrupt if key does not exists.
